page.title: 18LINDLEY CLOCK TOWER
page.content: The clock tower in Lidget Street, Lindley was built in 1902. It was built by a man named James Nields Sykes who lived at Fieldhead, Lindley. He owned a large factory there and his workers were always late for work. Their excuse always was that they had not got a watch,therefore he built the clock tower so they knew the time. Above the door of the clock tower is a small foundation stone which says{ {"For the purpose of his village"}as well as who it was built by. On the walls there are four statues, two of farmers sowing and harvesting and two angels praying. At each corner of the green roof there are dragon heads.
